channel.title: Jagex... You honestly fail
channel.description:
Well, i was going through my recent emails and found this email from jagex. I dont know if this has been posted yet, if it has then im sorry. But i'm very curious about this. Did it happen to any of you? And why do you think it happened? Leave a comment below.
Dear Player, We regret to inform you that your account has received an infraction due to a Macroing offense. Please visit the appeal section under Account Management to view evidence of your infraction(s) and to appeal any infraction(s) that you feel were unjustified. To view the evidence please click here: http://secure.runescape.com/m=weblogin/loginform.ws?mod=offence-appeal&ssl=1&expired=0&dest=account_history.ws Please note: Due to a recent bug in our infraction system, some accounts may have received a void infraction. The majority of void infractions have been removed but we cannot ensure that all infractions have been removed. We urge you to visit the appeal section to appeal any unjustified infractions received due to system errors.the 'Safety and Security' section of the website. Many thanks, Jagex Ltd.

item.title: Jagex... You honestly fail
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:3, topic:385502”]I’m 90% sure it was the actual runescape site. I had forgot my password and it took me a few attempts to login, so…

EDIT: Just went to runescape.com and check my black marks and there’s something about macroing but it wont let me open it. So this is probably real.[/quote]

i got the same thing but it was real world trading, they said it was perm ban when i logged in onto runescape appeal thing it was scratched out… i went to the site as soon as i got the message while i was on msn

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex... You honestly fail
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

asshole_rule:

How was it fake? It told me I had typed in an invalid password serveral times (I had forgotten it)… AND I saw a macroing offense in my blackmarks that was crossed out. Also the link was working yesterday and it doesn’t say runescaye…

If it said it was invalid, it wants you to enter your REAL password, and it will still say it was invalid.

Your account will be gone soon.

Read full topic

anything regarding my RuneScape account I never open as I know that i’ll have a message in my Message Centre.

My tip to you is; Change your password.

item.title: Jagex... You honestly fail
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:1, topic:385502”]Well, i was going through my recent emails and found this email from jagex. I dont know if this has been posted yet, if it has then im sorry. But i’m very curious about this. Did it happen to any of you? And why do you think it happened? Leave a comment below.

[quote]
Dear Player,

We regret to inform you that your account has received an infraction due to a Macroing offense.
Please visit the appeal section under Account Management to view evidence of your infraction(s) and to appeal any infraction(s) that you feel were unjustified.

To view the evidence please click here: http://secure.runescape.com/m=weblogin/loginform.ws?mod=offence-appeal&ssl=1&expired=0&dest=account_history.ws

Please note: Due to a recent bug in our infraction system, some accounts may have received a void infraction. The majority of void infractions have been removed but we cannot ensure that all infractions have been removed. We urge you to visit the appeal section to appeal any unjustified infractions received due to system errors.the ‘Safety and Security’ section of the website.

Many thanks,
Jagex Ltd.[/quote][/quote]

The link was masked. I can spot a few errors in the email, and it would be the same as me putting runescape.com (mouseover the link or quote me to see what the link really is).

Read full topic
